attributes.comment:
Your proposed fee increase will make citizenship and permanent residence status
unattainable for many applicants. Isn't it possible to rethink this decision. With
service times being dreadful at USCIS, and the fact that you can't even accurately
track status of applications, I believe there should be major improvement in service
before you start charging people more money. You should look into a
Congressional appropriation for accomplishing this. People who use this service
are already paying taxes on incomes, property and sales. If they put into the pot,
they should be able to take some out now and again.

Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By James A. Wakefield
